reviews.review_text: This review is from the standpoint of a competitive player already familiar with the game, intended for those who are also familiar with the game, but unsure about the quality of the port.   Pros
Buy this. Just buy this.

I abso-friggin'-lutely recommend this game to hell and back. Hope you have a gamepad of some sort if you plan on standing a chance! I guess my only complaint is the lack of an excellent tutorial section like BlazBlue, but when was the last time a GG game had one of those? Brilliant fighting mechanics, AMAZING soundtrack, all you need! Settle petty arguments in a manner most satisfactory.  I never could own any other version of this game, so I'm more than stoked that it's on Steam. Grab this game and you'll never feel more heartbroken when you have to drop the controller and go to work. Best fighting game possibly on all of Steam.

Mutha♥♥♥♥in' guilty gear. Odds are, if you're even on this store page outside of a recommendation, you've already played this ages-old game, and are looking to play it again. Do it.   Guilty Gear is a well established fighting game series which comes to us from Arc System Works, veterans of the genre. Both their other franchise BlazBlue as well as Guilty Gear have much to offer. Characters are extremely well designed, with each one boasting their own select set of skills and moves. The best part of Guilty Gear, and the feature that sets it well apart from other fighting games, is the balance of the fighters. Nearly every game I play with friends ends up with one of us on a pixel left of health by the end of the match. This makes the fights feel EXTREMELY intense, and any game that can actually get my heart going is a game I'm interested in. Button mashing isn't enough, and you'll come to learn all sorts of new techniques and mechanics as you play.   HIGHLY recommended for ANY fan of fighting games.
All I have to say is: Rush That ♥♥♥♥ Down and buy this game. This my fourth time buying it, too.

This is a fantastically crafted fighting game, i would recommend to any fans of guilty gear xrd or really fighting games in general. The biggest issue is that there isn't any people who play online really at all so you'll need a friend to play with, other than that its wonderfull and i highly reccomend.

I don't usually play a lot of fighting games, but this is by far the best of the ones I have played. Enough to make me want to finally get a controller. Just about everything about it is fantastic, beyond, as I've heard, the netcode. The voice samples are late-ninties quality, but they fit. I'm looking forward to finally being able to play a fighter with something other than a keyboard, and getting my friends to do some local fights.

Solid port, contains both the original AC which I prefer and the new AC +R version as well. Unfortunately I purchased this game for the Multiplayer(already owned AC) and the net code for this port is absolutely awful. It works OK if you live close to the person you're playing, but everyone I've ever matched with on-line lagged really bad and the game was unplayable. I much prefer the #Reload port of this game, the On-line is way more populated and the lag is very playable with anyone above 140Ping.
